# Draft:Isobel Award

----
The Isobel Award is an annual award ceremony held at Carlowrie Castle, Edinburgh, Scotland. Named after the botanist, explorer and author, Isobel Wylie Hutchison - Carlowrie Castle was her family home - it is presented to an individual or group who has faced challenges.
Winners
Past winners include: Karen Darke (2019), Amy Bray (2020), The Superpower Agency (2021), The Nurture Project (2022), and Art in Healthcare (2023). In 2024, the Isobel Award was presented by Gail Porter to the mental health charity, With Kids. Porter was chosen as the guest speaker for the event after speaking publicly about her struggles with mental health. The 2025 winner was Scottish charity, The Polar Academy for its efforts to lift young people out of "invisibility" and empower them to become resourceful, curious, and confident individuals. The Polar Academy is lead by explorer Craig Mathieson. The award was presented by Jen Cusick, events director at Carlowrie Castle, and Elise Wortley, adventurer.
